ygData.messageBody:
I'd like to add on this strategy :) Just order 10 tunics and see how great they
think their prices are after they make it :) If you REALLY want to be a jerk (I
wouldn't do this, personally), order the tunics, make sure they're making them,
then log off :) That's too mean for me, though, I wouldn't do that. I'd just
order a ton of tunics and watch as they lose money. Then I'd suggest they sell
them at the raised prices that I am and watch as they get all happy and realize
they could make money after all :)

If you need an excuse to order that many tunics, just say you're supplying your
guild. If you don't have a guild, go anonymous first :)

-Rennin of E'Ci
Trade Council GM

Shane Waggoner wrote:

> From: "Shane Waggoner" <shanemw@...>
>
> As for the fixed prices, I'm all for it. I haven't reached the level where
> I can make banded yet, but when I get there, I want more than a few gold
> profit for my wares. I do have a further suggestion though. When you see
> people selling at a few gold above cost, bargain with them to get their
> prices lower, and buy out their stock. Then, sell it yourself at the fixed
> price. So long as the person doesn't run fight back to the forge and make
> up a new suit of 3gp profit banded, you've got yourself more supply without
> the time and effort of making it and without and without the failure costs.
>
> My two cents, free of charge.
>
